meanings.definition: Blamming (verb): assigning blame or responsibility for something
meanings.sent1: She was blamming her brother for breaking the vase.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was blamming the students for not completing their homework.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were blamming each other for the missing cookies.
meanings.sent4: The detective was blamming the suspect for the crime.
meanings.sent5: The boss was blamming the employee for the project failure.

meanings.definition: Blamming (noun): the act of blaming or accusing someone
meanings.sent1: The blamming of the defendant in court was intense.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the constant blamming in the office.
meanings.sent3: The blamming in the family meeting was getting out of hand.
meanings.sent4: The blamming in the political debate was overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The blamming after the accident caused tension among friends.

meanings.definition: Blamming (adjective): characterized by blaming or accusing others
meanings.sent1: Her blamming attitude was causing conflicts in the team.
meanings.sent2: The blamming culture in the company was toxic.
meanings.sent3: His blamming behavior was not appreciated by his friends.
meanings.sent4: The blamming environment at school was stressful for students.
meanings.sent5: The blamming nature of the relationship led to its downfall.
